title: Markets tumble with IT shares hit by renewed anxiety over AI impact
summary: AI company Anthropic's blog post triggered a significant sell-off in Indian IT stocks, causing benchmark indices to fall sharply. The Nifty IT index plunged 4.7%, reflecting investor anxiety over AI's potential to automate legacy system maintenance, as seen with IBM's substantial decline. Analysts anticipate further downside for the IT sector.

title: Pre-market action: Here's the trade setup for today's session
summary: Indian benchmark indices experienced a sharp decline, ending their two-session rally due to the monthly Nifty F&O expiry. Analysts observe Nifty consolidating within a specific range, with a breakout or breakdown expected to signal the next directional trend. Volatility is anticipated to persist amidst global uncertainties.

title: Stocks in news: IRFC, Voltas, IDFC First Bank, Alembic Pharma, Lupin
summary: Markets declined sharply on Tuesday due to weak global cues, with the Nifty retesting crucial support near 25,400. Several stocks like IRFC, Voltas, IDFC First Bank, Alembic Pharma, and Lupin are in focus today due to significant news developments, including government stake sales, price hike expectations, and USFDA approvals.

title: Govt to divest up to 4% in IRFC via OFS at Rs 104/ Share
summary: The government is divesting up to a 4% stake in Indian Railway Finance Corporation (IRFC) through an offer for sale. The divestment begins with a 2% stake sale, with an additional 2% green shoe option available. The offer opens for non-retail investors on Wednesday and retail investors on Thursday, with a floor price of ₹104 per share.

title: IDFC First Bank pays Rs 583 crore to Haryana government
summary: IDFC First Bank has settled ₹583 crore with the Haryana government despite an ongoing financial fraud investigation. The bank confirmed full payment of principal and interest, emphasizing its commitment to customer-first principles and cooperation with authorities to apprehend those responsible. This proactive payment was made without waiting for the investigation's conclusion.

title: BookMyForex suffers a major data breach; thousands defrauded
summary: BookMyForex users face fraud after a major data breach. Thousands of customers are reportedly defrauded, with unauthorized transactions occurring on their forex cards. Many users could not access the platform to secure their funds. The company has escalated the issue to Yes Bank, its banking partner, for chargeback proceedings.

title: Stock Radar: Aster DM Healthcare stock recovers from lows; reclaims crucial moving averages – time to buy?
summary: Aster DM Healthcare stock has surged over 50% from its March 2025 lows, reclaiming key moving averages. Experts suggest a buy for medium-term traders targeting Rs 740, citing bullish technical indicators and a breakout above previous resistance levels.

title: Banks' liquidity buffers shrink as deposits lag credit growth
summary: Banks are confronting mounting liquidity pressures as loan portfolios expand faster than deposit bases. As a result, liquidity coverage ratios have weakened across a broad set of institutions. Even with abundant liquidity in the wider financial system, banks are struggling to bring in new deposits, pushing up near-term funding costs.

title: Indian economy now more resilient to shocks, says RBI deputy governor Poonam Gupta
summary: RBI Deputy Governor Poonam Gupta stated India's economy is now more resilient to internal and external shocks, fostering macroeconomic stability and an improving growth trajectory. She highlighted a "virtuous cycle of accelerated growth and macroeconomic stability," supported by a robust banking sector and expanding non-banking space.

summary: Gift Nifty was trading around 25,672 level, a premium of nearly 72 points from the Nifty futures’ previous close, indicating a positive start for the Indian stock market indices.

summary: Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. said a new $31-a-share buyout offer from Paramount Skydance Corp. could lead to a better deal than its existing agreement with Netflix Inc., kicking off another potential round of bidding for the famed Hollywood studio.

title: Suzlon Energy rejigs top deck with an eye on growth, diversification
summary: New CEO Ajay Kapur has taken charge at Suzlon as the company reshuffles leadership to power its next growth cycle. With long-time chief J.P. Chalasani moving to steer diversification, the now net cash-positive wind major is scaling installations and expanding into project development.

title: Gen Z and millennials power India's rapid upgrade cycle, making old brand loyalty a thing of the past
summary: Indian consumers, especially young urban professionals, are increasingly replacing their home appliances, electronics, and even furniture much faster than before. Long-term ownership is now shifting to a 2-3-year upgrade cycle.

title: Why BWH Hotels is betting on tier 2 India to hit  ₹500 crore revenue
summary: BWH Hotels expects its revenue in India to grow to  ₹300 crore by FY27, with a goal of  ₹500 crore by FY30. The company is set to open more hotels, expanding its portfolio to 100 by FY30, primarily in northern and central India.

title: Returning to India? What happens to your US assets and will?
summary: Under the Foreign Exchange Management Act, 1999, assets acquired while you were a non-resident can continue to be held, transferred or reinvested abroad even after you return to India.

summary: Markets are betting that the global M&A surge has not yet finished, as Wall Street recovered its appetite for large-scale financings.

summary: The government will sell up to 4% of its stake in Indian Railway Finance Corporation. The Offer for Sale begins Wednesday for institutional investors and Thursday for retail investors. title: IT stock crash wipes out Rs 1.2 lakh crore for LIC & mutual funds in bloodbath not seen since 2008
summary: India's top financial institutions, LIC and mutual funds, have suffered significant losses as the Nifty IT index plunged 21%. Investors face a dilemma between beaten-down valuations and uncertain future fundamentals.

title: Afcons Infrastructure shares tumble 4% after client terminates contract worth €113 million

The €113.03 million project for National Road NR1 in Gabon is nearing completion. Afcons disputes the termination, asserting it is inconsistent with contract terms. The company is pursuing legal remedies.

summary: &nbsp;SAIL share price rises 4.4% to  ₹167.20, buoyed by a positive report from Emkay Global raising its target price to  ₹200. The brokerage anticipates improved margins and profitability despite rising coking coal costs, projecting EBITDA per tonne to increase significantly.

title: Battered pipe makers eye Q4 revival as PVC prices rebound
summary: In Q3, falling PVC prices and aggressive competition had weighed on realizations across pipe companies. Delays in anti-dumping duty implementation and Bureau of Indian Standards norms enforcement have also blurred the sector’s earnings growth visibility.

title: Exide Industries to Colgate Palmolive - Jay Thakkar suggests 3 stocks to buy or sell for short-term in F&O segment
summary: The Indian stock market rose significantly on Wednesday, with the Sensex gaining nearly 700 points. Analysts recommend futures in Cholamandalam, Colgate Palmolive, and Exide Industries, highlighting bullish trends and support levels, despite ongoing cautious sentiment among investors.

title: Aston Martin layoffs: British automaker to cut 20% of total workforce; aims to recover from US tariff impact — Details
summary: Aston Martin is set to lay off 20% of the company's total workforce as the automaker aims to recover from the impact of the raging US tariffs amid weak demand from China. Here's what you need to know about the job cuts, future outlook and stock price movement.&nbsp;

title: Trump makes little mention of China in the longest State of the Union speech
summary: U.S. President Donald Trump is scheduled to visit Beijing from March 31 to April 2, after a year of heightened trade tensions between the two countries.

title: Market Wrap: Sensex ends 50 pts higher, Nifty above 25,400 as bank stocks keep rally in check
summary: At close, Sensex was up a little over 50 points at 82,276. This marks a fall of around 682 points from its intraday high of 82,958, which it had hit in the morning amid strong buying in IT stocks. Nifty 50 ended the session around 58 points higher at 25,482, after falling over 170 points from its day’s high of 25,653.

title: More trouble for broader markets? CLSA sees high EPS downgrade risks in smallcaps, here's why
summary: International brokerage CLSA has said that it continues to favour large caps, but sees more EPS downgrades for small cap stocks.

title: TCS can offer Rs 35 dividend, share buyback soon, says CLSA after Rs 3,593 target price
summary: CLSA has maintained an Outperform rating on Tata Consultancy Services with a target price of Rs 3,593, implying 39% upside. The brokerage sees scope for a Rs 35 Q4 dividend and a potential buyback. However, AI disruption concerns and macroeconomic risks continue to weigh on IT sector valuations.

title: Manilam Industries IPO allotment to be finalised today; latest GMP, 4 steps to check status
summary: Manilam Industries IPO allotment is set for today, February 25. Investors can check their allotment status on Mas Services Limited's portal. The IPO subscription was 6.25 times, with refunds for unsuccessful applicants starting February 26 and shares allocated on the same day.

title: Top Gainers & Losers on Feb 25: Waaree Energies, Premier Energies, Welspun Living, IRFC, Adani Power among top losers
summary: The Indian stock market ended February 25 with modest gains, as key indices recovered slightly. IT stocks rallied after previous losses, while metal and auto sectors supported the indices. The Nifty 50 rose 0.23%, and broader markets outperformed frontline indices.

title: Sensex, Nifty 50 end in the green; mid, small-caps outperform— 10 key highlights from the Indian stock market today
summary: The Sensex finished at 82,276.07, up 50 points, or 0.06%, while the Nifty 50 closed 58 points, or 0.23%, higher at 25,482.50.

title: Clean Max Enviro IPO: QIB portion subscribed two times, followed by HNI demand
summary: The  ₹3,100 crore IPO comprises a fresh issue of 1.14 crore shares for  ₹1,200 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 1.80 crore shares for  ₹1,900 crore. The price band of the issue was fixed at  ₹1,000 to  ₹1,053 per share.

title: Puravankara to launch 3 luxury projects in upmarket Mumbai, eyes Gurugram entry
summary: Puravankara Ltd plans to launch three luxury residential projects in Mumbai's premium areas, with homes starting at  ₹1 lakh per square foot. This is part of a  ₹15,200 crore launch pipeline, which includes various developments across cities like Bengaluru and Kochi over the next 10-12 months.

title: I never paid for a flight ticket in past 10 years: Ashish Lath, CEO, SaveSage
summary: In the past 10 years, Ashish Lath took 400 flights without spending any money, which includes around 80 international ones. He stayed in hotels for 100 nights without paying anything, getting 23% return on expenses in value terms by using 15 credit cards.

title: Radhika Gupta's advice on which investment strategy to avoid: ‘The most expensive fund is…’
summary: Radhika Gupta is popular among Indian investors for her easily understood investment tips and advice, stock market fundas, and investment explainers. She has now shared another simple rule of thumb — consistency is key.

title: ​Union Bank Of India among 6 Financial Services stocks that hit 52-week high; rally up to 15% in a month​
Emerging-Market Rally Builds as Korea Tops France in Stock Ranks
summary: Emerging-market stocks and currencies climbed to fresh records on Wednesday, with the latest Asian tech gains lifting South Korea’s bourse to the world’s ninth largest, topping both France and Germany.

title: Rupee ends flat at 90.95 amid US dollar demand and NDF maturities
summary: Indian rupee remained stable at 90.9475 against the dollar amid strong dollar demand from maturing contracts. While state-run banks sold dollars above 90.95, expectations of Reserve Bank intervention limited bearish sentiment. Indian equities rose slightly, and Asian currencies saw modest gains.

title: IT stocks selloff! LIC loses  ₹38,000 crore, MFs 63,000 crore in Feb so far on AI disruption fears
summary: Nifty IT index has plunged 21% in February so far, and is poised for its worst monthly performance in nearly 23 years. This has also weighed on the performance of the Indian stock market's benchmark index, as the IT companies command over 10% weightage.

title: Q3 Results 2026: Small-caps lead with 22% earnings growth, beat mid-caps and large-caps
summary: In Q3FY26, small-cap companies in India reported a 22% YoY earnings growth, outpacing mid and large caps. Equirus Securities indicates a positive trend in corporate earnings recovery, supported by strong performance in consumption, financials, and technology sectors.

title: TCS’ Krithivasan urges senior employees to build AI solutions
summary: TCS leadership has asked senior executives to personally develop AI solutions to bridge the gap between junior staff and management.

title: Indian stocks set for another lacklustre year amid geopolitical uncertainty: Poll
summary: Optimism about Indian stocks among equity strategists has waned from three months ago, although analysts ​still expect benchmark indices to scale new highs ​by mid-year, according to a Reuters poll.

title: Gainers & Losers: Concord Biotech, IRFC among 6 top movers on Wednesday
summary: Indian stocks saw sharp moves as Concord Biotech surged 17% on heavy volumes, Lloyds Metals and Energy and Schaeffler India gained on positive triggers, while IRFC, Waaree Energies and State Bank of India declined.

title: Omnitech Engineering IPO: Issue receives tepid response on Day 01, subscribed 0.09 times. GMP signals flat listing
summary: Omnitech Engineering's IPO saw limited investor interest, with 0.09 times subscription by day's end. The  ₹583 crore issue includes new shares and an offer for sale. The estimated listing price is  ₹232, based on a grey market premium (GMP) of  ₹5 per share.

title: IT stocks under pressure: How investors should restructure their tech portfolio in 2026 amid AI disruption
summary: As AI reshapes the tech landscape, investors may consider diversifying their portfolios beyond traditional IT stocks. Experts emphasise a balanced approach that includes AI enablers and U.S. tech giants, while also preparing for potential volatility in the sector.&nbsp;

title: Shree Ram Twistex IPO sees bumper 44 times bids on final day; GMP signals 13% listing gains. Details here
summary: According to data from BSE, Shree Ram Twistex IPO was subscribed 43.66 times as it garnered bids for 46,28,41,632 shares as against 1,06,00,000 shares on offer. The NII portion was booked the most at 220.30 times.

title: Gold gains on softer dollar, safe‑haven bid amid US tariff uncertainty
summary: GLOBAL-PRECIOUS/ (UPDATE 6):PRECIOUS-Gold gains on softer dollar, safe‑haven bid amid US tariff uncertainty

title: Netflix’s Warner deal may be dead. Why the streamer should make a ‘graceful exit.’
summary: The most likely outcome is that Netflix will walk away from the bidding war. That’s good news for its shareholders.

title: Penicillin shot: Will Aurobindo Pharma’s audacious bet rejuvenate antibiotic production in India?
summary: In a coastal plant brimming with fermenters, Aurobindo Pharma is attempting what few thought possible again: the large-scale manufacture of penicillin in India. With government backing, the company is challenging China’s dominance over the basic antibiotic ingredient.

title: Philippines Should Work With China on Stalled Gas Project, Tycoon Says
summary: A Philippine tycoon said partnering with China may be an option in the development of a new gas field in an area of the South China Sea where the two nations have competing maritime claims.

title: Zerodha's Nithin Kamath bats for loan against shares facility to service high interest loans
summary: Nithin Kamath said Zerodha’s Loan Against Shares business has crossed Rs 500 crore, calling it a secured way to repay high-interest debt. Offered via Zerodha Capital, LAS provides lower rates. He also clarified DP charges and urged investors to check hidden costs.

title: Tech, AI to play big role in strengthening mkt surveillance, improving risk management: Sebi chief
summary: Sebi chairman Tuhin Kanta Pandey on Wednesday said that technology, including artificial intelligence, will play an expanding role in strengthening surveillance, enhancing transparency and deepening investor awareness.

title: Up 780% in 3 years! Multibagger Shaily Engineering stock to be in focus on Thursday after  ₹423 crore order win
summary: Shaily Engineering, with a market cap of  ₹8,921 crore, secured a  ₹423 crore contract for pen injectors with a major pharma firm. Despite recent stock struggles, the company reported a net profit increase to  ₹37 crore year-on-year, although it faced a sequential decline.

title: Bullish on India, Wyndham Hotels to add 55 properties, double rooms
summary: Wyndham Hotels plans to expand in India with 55 new hotels, increasing its portfolio to 150. The US hospitality company is focusing on larger properties and targeting tier-II and -III cities, anticipating higher occupancy rates and revenue growth in the coming years.

title: BillDesk to acquire Worldline India payment businesses
summary: The acquisition of the French payments firm by BillDesk comes nearly 10 months after&nbsp;Mint exclusively reported that Worldline had initiated a process to explore a potential sale of its India operations as part of a broader global restructuring.

title: Lodha secures development rights for prime Malabar Hill property
summary: As part of the deal, Lodha will be entitled to develop 5,017 square metres of carpet area (saleable area), along with 150 car parking spaces and a 42.5% share in the trust overseeing the project.

title: Xiaomi moves Supreme Court against $72 million customs demand; notice issued
summary: The Supreme Court’s decision in Xiaomi royalty case is expected to have significant implications for multinational companies in India
